content:
I notice both furnaces have the warning "no ingredients to smelt" - they need more iron ore. Let's:
1. Add more iron ore to both furnaces
2. Extract the remaining iron plates
3. Continue our production

```python
# Get our furnace positions
furnace1 = get_entities()[0]
furnace2 = get_entities()[1]

# First extract any remaining iron plates
extract_item(Prototype.IronPlate, furnace1.position, quantity=20)  # From furnace result
extract_item(Prototype.IronPlate, furnace2.position, quantity=22)  # From furnace result

# Add more iron ore to both furnaces
insert_item(Prototype.IronOre, furnace1, quantity=25)
insert_item(Prototype.IronOre, furnace2, quantity=25)

# Check our updated status
print("After extracting plates and adding more ore:")
print(f"Current inventory: {inspect_inventory()}")
print("\nFurnace status:")
print(get_entities())

# Craft more iron gear wheels with our new plates
craft_item(Prototype.IronGearWheel, quantity=10)  # Each gear wheel needs 2 iron plates

print("\nFinal inventory after crafting:")
print(inspect_inventory())
```

This should:
1. Extract all remaining iron plates from both furnaces
2. Add fresh iron ore to continue smelting
3. Use our new iron plates to craft more iron gear wheels
